The Cairngorms park is a pretty big place. You tend to think of just the mountains in the middle but it covers around 4,500 km\^2 or nearly 1,750 sq miles. It has a [dedicated website](https://cairngorms.co.uk/) with lots of information if you're interested.

Whilst I'm trying to activate and qualify all 87 GM/ES sota summits, I also wondered about all the summits within the Cairngorms. This extends into CS and WS. Using a [Cairngorms GeoJSON file](https://cartographyvectors.com/map/1359-cairngorms-national-park), and the summit lists from the [sota database](https://www.sotadata.org.uk/en/association/GM) I was able to find those within the park.

I think there are 82 summits: 44 in ES, 36 in CS, and 2 in WS. Below is a map to explore and also a list. [Here's a CSV of them](cairngorms_summits.csv).

I think a fun project would be to make a Cairngorms activator award, for those who activate every summit in the Cairngorms.

## Map View

```{ojs}
L = require('leaflet@1.9.4')

// Load the GeoJSON file
geojson = FileAttachment("cairngorms.geojson").json()

// Load the CSV file
summits = FileAttachment("cairngorms_summits.csv").csv({typed: true})

// Function to get a colored marker icon based on value
function getColor(value) {
  switch (value) {
    case 1: return "DarkGreen";
    case 2: return "LimeGreen";
    case 4: return "Olive";
    case 6: return "Orange";
    case 8: return "OrangeRed";
    case 10: return "Red";
    default: return "Gray"; // Default color for undefined values
  }
}

map = {
  let container = DOM.element('div', { style: `width:${width}px;height:${width/1.6}px` });
  yield container;

  let map = L.map(container).setView([57.07, -3.7], 8.5);
  let osmLayer = L.tileLayer('https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png', {
      attribution: '&copy; <a href="https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright">OpenStreetMap</a> contributors'
  }).addTo(map);

  // Add the GeoJSON layer
  L.geoJSON(geojson).addTo(map);

  // Add summit markers
  summits.forEach(({ latitude, longitude, points, name, summitCode }) => {
      L.circleMarker([+latitude, +longitude], {
        radius: 8,
        color: getColor(points), // Use the color function
        fillColor: getColor(points),
        fillOpacity: 0.8
      }).bindPopup(`Summit: ${name}<br>Reference: <a href="https://sotl.as/summits/${summitCode}" target="_blank">${summitCode}</a><br>Points: ${points}`)
      .addTo(map);
  });

}

```
